sentences.english: He investigates complaints large and small that come to him from all levels of society.
sentences.chinese: 他要调查来自社会各个阶层的大大小小的冤屈不平。

sentences.english: God requires that we speak up and defend those who are being falsely accused.
sentences.chinese: 上帝要求我们为那些冤屈的人开口辩屈。

sentences.english: The new government removed the injustice under which the population had labored.
sentences.chinese: 新政府洗雪了人民过去所蒙受的冤屈。

sentences.english: In this way, the maid cleared herself of the injustice and the thief got the moneybag.
sentences.chinese: 这样，女仆洗清了冤屈，钱袋也到了那骗子手上。

sentences.english: He poured out all his grievances.
sentences.chinese: 他把一肚子的冤屈都倒了出来。

sentences.english: They redressed the grievances done to the chief engineer years ago.
sentences.chinese: 他们为好几年前总工程师所蒙受的冤屈平反昭雪。

sentences.english: He brayed out his grievances before the judge.
sentences.chinese: 他在法官面前大声申诉冤屈。

sentences.english: She is suffering a huge injustice, but finds it hard to defend herself.
sentences.chinese: 她受到了莫大的冤屈，却有口难辩。

definition: facts of an injustice/circumstances surrounding a miscarriage of justice
to appeal for justice/to demand redress for a grievance
to right wrongs/to redress an injustice
to exonerate/to clear (from an accusation)/to rehabilitate
to be wronged/to be subjected to an injustice
lit. to wash out a grievance/fig. to right a wrong/to redress an injustice
to reverse a verdict/to present different views on a historical person or verdict
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to redress (an injustice)/to rehabilitate (sb whose reputation was unjustly sullied)
